intro: Phelipanche persica, commonly known as the Persian morning glory, is an annual flowering plant belonging to the Convolvulaceae family. It is characterized by its erect or trailing growth habit and produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink to purple in color. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and is known for its rapid growth and ability to thrive in a variety of soil types. It is native to regions of the Middle East and parts of southern Europe. Due to its invasive potential, it is often considered a weed in agricultural settings.
